questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing VSAN 10 on multiple Cisco Nexus 5600 Series Switches and must ensure that the full zone set and active zone set are identical across the fabric. Which configuration must be implemented to meet this requirement?

choices.D: switch(config)# zoneset activate name ZONE10 vsan 10

questions.question_text:
Which value is missing in the field in the key called “msg” in this JSON response?

Request:



Response:

choices.B:
Enable option 67.
Define TFTP transfer protocol.
choices.D:
Enable option 46.
Define TFTP transfer protocol.
choices.C:
Enable option 43.
Define HTTP transfer protocol.
choices.A:
Enable option 35.
Define HTTP transfer protocol.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is B, could not be D because:

Option 46 (NetBIOS Node Type): This DHCP option specifies the NetBIOS over TCP/IP node type, determining how NetBIOS name resolution is performed (e.g., broadcast, point-to-point, or a combination). This option is not relevant for specifying the boot file name or facilitating the POAP process.

HTTP isn't possible because it's TCP. 
Option 67 is required. See here:
https://community.cisco.com/t5/other-data-center-subjects/poap-via-dhcp/td-p/2765022

Selected Answer: C
Option 67 is out as it states it uses HTTP and is paired with TFTP (Most voted here): 
POAP used options 66 and 67 for IPv4, and options 77 and 15 for IPv6 to extract the booting script information. However, the transfer of the script uses http, and is not very secure.

Option 43 (Answer C): 
option 43 specifies the secure POAP related provisioning script information for IPv4 and option 17 specifies the same for IPv6. Additionally, these options allow the POAP to reach the file server in a secure manner. 

You can see Option 43 goes into configuring a network in this config guide and others stated is reasonable. Going to say C. myself. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/nx-os/nexus9000/102x/configuration/fundamentals/cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-fundamentals-configuration-guide-102x/m-using-poap.html#:~:text=not%20very%20secure.-,Beginning%20with%20Cisco%20NX%2DOS%20Release%2010.2(3)F,server%20in%20a%20secure%20manner.

comments.content: Source? I have not able to find any CISCO documentation saying anything from option 46 only 67

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Option 35 is typically associated with ARP cache timeout and is not relevant for POAP.
Option 67 is the Bootfile-Name option in DHCP, which specifies the name of the boot file but doesn't include POAP-specific directives.
Option 43 is used in network configurations to specify vendor-specific options but it's not specifically for POAP.
The correct option for initiating POAP in this scenario is:

Option 46 which is specifically used by Cisco Nexus switches to initiate POAP. The DHCP response including this option would tell the switch where to obtain its configuration file and system image.
Therefore, the correct answer is:

D. Enable option 46. Define TFTP transfer protocol.

This option correctly utilizes DHCP Option 46 for POAP and specifies TFTP as the transfer protocol, which uses UDP, thus meeting the requirement that only UDP is permitted between the Nexus 9000 switch and the server. This setup will allow the switch to automatically download its configuration and software image in accordance with POAP guidelines.

Selected Answer: B
DHCP Option 67 contains the URL of the provisioning file location.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B - HTTp is the TCP

Strange question the requirement is just use UDP http uses tcp/udp. 
Option 43 means that protocol use ipv4 address.

questions.question_text:
An engineer must perform a POAP deployment of a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch. The switch must automatically receive its software image and configuration file upon power-on. Also, only UDP is permitted between the Nexus 9000 switch and the server that hosts the Cisco NX-OS system images.

Which set of actions completes the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A seems final

Selected Answer: A
On-Box Python is Python interpreter installed inside the Guest Shell that allows to run Python scripts on IOS XE router or switch
A is the correct

choices.B: Develop an application by using serverless technologies in a primary cloud provider.
choices.C: Develop an off-box Python script that uses trusted Cisco libraries.
choices.A: Develop an on-box Python script that uses trusted Cisco libraries.
choices.D: Develop a containerization application that uses trusted Cisco-provided libraries.

questions.question_text:
A DevOps engineer must use Python to manage a Cisco device. The device is in a highly secure DMZ environment. Only trusted Cisco Python libraries can be used.

Which solution meets the requirements?

A network administrator attempts to automate the provisioning of several new Cisco Nexus switches. The administrator prepares a bootstrap configuration script for the task. Due to the number of switches, a zero-touch provisioning solution is preferred. Additionally, some switches arrive with outdated software and should be automatically upgraded as part of the provisioning workflow. Which solution meets the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. POAP (PowerOn Auto Provisioning) is the solution that meets the given requirements. POAP is a feature in Cisco Nexus switches that automates the provisioning process. When a new switch boots up, it automatically obtains its IP address via DHCP and then contacts a designated POAP server to download a configuration script that can perform the necessary setup tasks. POAP can also check the switch's software version and automatically upgrade it if necessary.
